mean.name: Mean (Average)
mean.content:
Mean (Arithmetic Mean)

The sum of all values divided by the number of values.

Formula:

μ = (Σx)/n for population
x̄ = (Σx)/n for sample

Key Points:
  • Affected by outliers
  • Most common measure of central tendency
  • Used for interval and ratio data
Example:

Data: 4, 8, 6, 5, 3
Mean = (4+8+6+5+3)/5 = 26/5 = 5.2

median.name: Median
median.content:
Median

The middle value when data is arranged in order.

Key Points:
  • Not affected by outliers
  • For odd n: middle value
  • For even n: average of two middle values
  • Used for ordinal, interval, ratio data
Example (odd):

Data: 3, 5, 7, 9, 11
Median = 7

Example (even):

Data: 2, 4, 6, 8
Median = (4+6)/2 = 5

mode.name: Mode
mode.content:
Mode

The most frequently occurring value.

Key Points:
  • Can have multiple modes (bimodal, multimodal)
  • Only measure for nominal data
  • May not exist if all values unique
Example:

Data: 2, 3, 3, 3, 5, 7, 7, 9
Mode = 3 (appears 3 times)

range.name: Range
range.content:
Range

The difference between maximum and minimum values.

Formula:

Range = Maximum - Minimum

Key Points:
  • Simple to calculate
  • Affected by outliers
  • Only uses two values

variance.name: Variance
variance.content:
Variance

Average of squared deviations from the mean.

Formulas:

σ² = Σ(x - μ)²/N (population)

s² = Σ(x - x̄)²/(n-1) (sample)

Key Points:
  • Measures spread of data
  • Square of standard deviation
  • Always non-negative

standard_deviation.name: Standard Deviation
standard_deviation.content:
Standard Deviation

Square root of variance.

Formulas:

σ = √[Σ(x - μ)²/N] (population)

s = √[Σ(x - x̄)²/(n-1)] (sample)

Key Points:
  • Most common measure of spread
  • Same units as original data
  • 68-95-99.7 rule for normal distributions

basic_concepts.name: Probability Fundamentals
basic_concepts.content:
Basic Probability

Definition:

P(Event) = (Favorable outcomes)/(Total possible outcomes)

Rules:
  • 0 ≤ P(E) ≤ 1
  • P(not E) = 1 - P(E)
  • Sum of all probabilities = 1

addition_rule.name: Addition Rule
addition_rule.content:
Addition Rule of Probability

For Mutually Exclusive Events:

P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B)

For Non-Mutually Exclusive Events:

P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B)

multiplication_rule.name: Multiplication Rule
multiplication_rule.content:
Multiplication Rule of Probability

For Independent Events:

P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B)

For Dependent Events:

P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B|A)
